title: Clark, Fever back investigation: No place for hate
content: Fever players on Monday supported the WNBA's investigation into allegations of "hateful fan comments" toward the Sky's Angel Reese.

title: Sources: 49ers make Warner NFL's top-paid LB
content: Linebacker Fred Warner and the 49ers reached agreement on a three-year, $63 million contract extension that includes over $56 million in guaranteed money, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Packers submit revision for tush push proposal
content: With the NFL's league meetings set to open up in Minneapolis on Tuesday, the Packers submitted a revision of their rule proposal that would more broadly ban pushing or pulling the ball carrier anywhere on the field, a strategy popularized by the Eagles.

title: NHL referee Rooney OK, hopes for playoff return
content: NHL referee Chris Rooney is hoping to resume duties during the Stanley Cup playoffs after taking a high stick to the eye in Game 7 of the second-round Eastern Conference playoff series between the Toronto Maple Leafs and Florida Panthers on Sunday night.

title: W. Clark sorry for flinging driver after errant shot
content: Wyndham Clark apologized for letting his frustrations get the best of him and flinging his driver after a poor shot during the final round of the PGA Championship.

title: Haliburton invites man trashed by N.Y. fans to G4
content: A Pacers fan pelted by garbage and heckled for wearing a Tyrese Haliburton jersey on the streets of New York City has been invited to Game 4 vs. the Knicks.

title: GM: Cavs must meet newly raised expectations
content: Cavaliers GM Koby Altman realizes expectations for the Cavaliers going into next season will be much different following a season that saw Cleveland win 64 games and earn the East's top seed.

title: Kaká on links with Ancelotti, Brazil: 'I'm ready'
content: Former Brazil icon Kaká addressed reports that he is in talks to join Carlo Ancelotti's backroom staff, saying he is "ready" to help his country at the 2026 World Cup should he get the opportunity.

title: 📚 NFL rookie's taste of being a pro
content: Rookies including Tyler Warren, Josh Conerly Jr. and Nick Martin share insight on their first days as an NFL player.

title: 8 things we learned from the WNBA's opening weekend
content: The Mystics might be better than projected. The Fever defense is better, period. Here's what we learned as the WNBA season opened.

title: Predicting Rounds 1 and 2 of the NBA draft after the combine
content: The draft could get interesting at No. 3. Here's how ESPN's Jonathan Givony and Jeremy Woo see it playing out.

title: NBA playoff MVPs: Herring's new top 8 after the conference semis
content: Our playoff MVP update features a Game 7 savior, two Wolves and a superstar that hasn't played in three weeks.

title: Who wins the Eastern Conference finals? Early look at keys to Hurricanes-Panthers
content: It's a rematch of the 2023 edition. Can Carolina win this time, or will Florida head back to the Cup Final?

title: 'Ueck was always first': How Christian Yelich is carrying on Bob Uecker's legacy with Brewers
content: Whether he's starring or slumping, Christian Yelich has taken the torch as the face of the franchise in Milwaukee.

title: How proposed CEO could dole out punishments in college sports
content: A decision on the House case is expected as soon as this week and could come with enforcement changes.

title: J.K. Dobbins to the Commanders? Jalen Ramsey to the Rams? Best fits for free agents, trade candidates
content: Some unsigned free agents are still looking for new teams, while there are often trades before training camps start in July. Given that, let's find fits for 14 available players.

title: Where things stand for each Ryder Cup team after two majors
content: Which players are locks to make each team? What tough decisions will captains Keegan Bradley and Luke Donald have to make? We break down how each team is shaping up.

title: How Amorim, Man United made Europa League final in spite of themselves
content: Man United are on the precipice heading into Wednesday's Europa League final vs. Tottenham, with more drama swirling around the club. And yet, a major trophy could represent a turning point.

title: Palace FA Cup joy, two-team Serie A title race goes to wire, more
content: Crystal Palace shocked Man City, Barcelona celebrated LaLiga success and Italy's title race had more drama.

title: Liverpool ratings: Salah gets 5/10 as champs fall to Brighton
content: Despite getting a guard of honor, Brighton & Hove Albion spoiled Liverpool's party where Mohamed Salah was unable to make an impact.

title: Source: Man City back out of race for Wirtz
content: After meeting with Bayer Leverkusen and Florian Wirtz's representatives, Manchester City are turning their attention to other targets, a source told ESPN.

title: Messi urges Miami to be 'united' in 'difficult' time
content: Inter Miami CF captain Lionel Messi urged the team to stay strong and remain united after losing 3-0 to in-state rival Orlando City SC at Chase Stadium on Sunday night.

title: Pep on UCL quali: City will get what we deserve
content: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola said on Monday that he was "absolutely" confident his side can seal one of the top five spots in the Premier League.

title: Mount focused on Man Utd success after injuries
content: Mason Mount has opened up on the "difficult" start to his Manchester United career as he plots to put two years of injury frustration behind him by winning the Europa League.

title: Valencia threaten to sue over Netflix Vini doc
content: Valencia have asked for an "immediate rectification" from the producers of Vinícius Júnior's Netflix documentary.

title: Kang rebrands women's club Lyon to OL Lyonnes
content: European women's powerhouse Olympique Lyonnais Féminin (Lyon) will rebrand as OL Lyonnes, majority owner Michele Kang announced on Monday.

title: Lineker leaves BBC after controversial IG post
content: The BBC has announced that Gary Lineker will step down from his presenting role following the final episode of this season's Match of the Day.

title: Ronaldo to join Botafogo? 'Can't say no' - coach
content: Botafogo's coach has said "you can't say no to a star like that" when asked whether Cristiano Ronaldo could join his team ahead of the Club World Cup.

title: MLS: Miami sliding as Philly reeling in Caps
content: Inter Miami have lost five of its past seven, losing touch with the leaders of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Panthers slight East favorites
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: Denver's biggest summer priority, plus offseason guides for every NBA team
content: NBA front office insider Bobby Marks breaks down the summer priorities and needs for every eliminated team.

title: Hamilton is optimistic after Imola, but Leclerc showcases Ferrari's ills
content: Lewis Hamilton was giddy after Imola, but that shouldn't overshadow Charles Leclerc's frustrations at Ferrari.

title: Was Imola a one-off or is Verstappen now a title contender?
content: Red Bull has taken a step forward, which means Max Verstappen's win at Imola might be a sign of things to come.

title: Waiver wire: NL Central southpaws lead top picks
content: Eric Karabell outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire and who you should be dropping from fantasy rosters.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United holding talks for Delap
content: Manchester United are reportedly beginning new talks to sign Ipswich Town's Liam Delap. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Op Sindoor Is "Not Over", Pak Must Hand Over Terrorist Hafiz Saeed: Indian Envoy
content: India's Ambassador to Israel JP Singh, has stressed that India's Operation Sindoor against Pakistan is "paused" and "not over", demanding that Islamabad should handover key terrorists Hafiz Saeed, Sajid Mir and Zakiur Rehman Lakhvi just like US did.

title: Special Team Formed To Probe Minister's Remark Against Sofia Qureshi
content: Madhya Pradesh Police constituted a three-member SIT late on Monday night to probe state minister Vijay Shah's remarks against Col Sofiya Qureshi in compliance with a Supreme Court order, an official said.

title: "Tumne Kiya Hai Shuru...": BJP Releases Song On Operation Sindoor
content: The BJP on Monday launched a song hailing the success of Operation Sindoor  the May 7 strikes by the Indian military in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) as well as inside Pakistani territory to destroy a series of terror dens and bases.

title: "Want To End War But Not Sure If Russia Is Ready": Zelensky
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday (local time) voiced his uncertainty about Russia's readiness to commit to a ceasefire, citing a lack of trust in Moscow's intentions.

title: "Operation Sindoor Is Clear Message To Terrorists": Smriti Irani
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta, along with former Union Minister Smriti Irani and BJP Mahila Morcha national president Vanathi Srinivasan, led a Tiranga Yatra in Delhi to honour the Indian Armed Forces for their crucial role in Operation Sindoor.

title: Yuri Grigorovich, Considered Among Greatest Choreographers Ever, Dies At 98
content: Russian ballet maestro Yuri Grigorovich, considered one of the greatest choreographers of the 20th century, has died at the age of 98, the Bolshoi Theatre said on Monday.

title: US Government To Pay $5 Million To Family Of Woman Shot At US Capitol Riot
content: The Trump administration has agreed to pay nearly $5 million to the family of a woman shot dead by a police officer during the January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol, The Washington Post reported on Monday.

title: UK, France, Canada Threaten Israel Against Gaza Offensive
content: The leaders of Britain, France, and Canada on Monday threatened action against Israel if it does not stop a renewed military offensive in Gaza and lift aid restrictions, piling further pressure on Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Elderly Man, 12-Year-Old Electrocuted Inside Flooded Basement In Bengaluru
content: An elderly man and a minor died of electric shock inside an inundated basement in an apartment complex in Bengaluru. The tragic incident capped a rainy day in Bengaluru that crippled the city on Monday.

title: "Would've Expelled": Chirag Paswan Slams Minister's Colonel Qureshi Remark
content: Union minister Chirag Paswan ripped into Madhya Pradesh minister Vijay Shah today over his comments on Colonel Sofiya Qureshi saying had anyone from his party made such a comment, he would have been expelled "for life".

title: "Will Be Inducted Into Maharashtra Cabinet Today": NCP's Chhagan Bhujbal
content: Senior Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Chhagan Bhujbal today said he will be inducted into the Maharashtra cabinet headed by Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Tuesday, marking his return to ministerial office after a long gap.

title: 'Ready To Work To End Ukraine Conflict': Putin After 2-Hour Call With Trump
content: Donald Trump and Russia's Vladimir Putin spoke over the phone for more than two hours on Monday, brainstorming, and possibly negotiating, what it would take for Moscow and Kyiv to agree to a fast, if not immediate ceasefire in Ukraine.

title: "Russia, Ukraine Will Immediately Start Ceasefire Negotiations": Trump After Call With Putin
content: Minutes after his two-hour-long phone call with Russian President Vladimir Putin, US President Donald Trump declared on his Truth Social platform that Russia and Ukraine will immediately start negotiations towards a ceasefire.

title: Italian Designer Pierpaolo Piccioli Named Balenciaga's Creative Director
content: Italian designer Pierpaolo Piccioli has been named creative director at fashion house Balenciaga, taking over from Georgian designer Demna, parent company Kering said Monday.

title: "Who Are Bigger Sharks": Vice President On Delay In FIR In Judge Cash Row
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar dwelt at length on the finding of cash at the premises of a Delhi High Court judge, pushing for a police probe and a relook at the Supreme Court judgment that ruled prior sanction be required to prosecute judges.

title: "He Has Only Illusion To Offer": Women's Panel On Ashoka University Professor
content: The Ashoka University professor who landed in controversy after his social media post mentioning Colonel Sofiya Qureshi has the "right to speech but not the right to demoralise, degrade women," said Renu Bhatia, chairperson of Haryana Women's Panel

title: "Authenticity Of Photo Being Verified": Assam Rifles On "Militant Flag" Pic Row
content: The Assam Rifles today said it is checking the authenticity of a photograph that purportedly showed a group of men in the force's uniform holding flags that social media users claimed belonged to an insurgent group in the northeast.

title: Indian Tanks Operated From LoC During Op Sindoor, Took Out Pak Posts
content: T-72 tanks had rolled up to the Line of Control and took part in the May 7 Operation Sindoor that had destroyed terror bases in 9 locations in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir, an officer of the Indian army has told NDTV in an exclusive intervi

title: Mumbai Woman, Teen Boyfriend Arrested Over Rape, Murder Of Minor Girl: Cops
content: A woman and her teen boyfriend were arrested on Monday in connection with the rape and murder of her two-and-half-year-old daughter, a Mumbai police official said.

title: Maharashtra Minister Apologises To Chief Justice Over 'Protocol Lapse' In Mumbai
content: Maharashtra Cabinet minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule on Monday said he personally phoned and apologized to Chief Justice of India (CJI) B R Gavai on behalf of the state government over 'protocol lapse' during the latter's visit to Mumbai.

title: Nehru gave Pak not only water but also money: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
content: Days after calling the 1960 treaty a "historic mistake", Union agriculture minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Monday met farmers organisations and explained to them how the then PM Jawaharlal Nehru signed the treaty despite opposition from experts. He said that Nehru not only agreed to give water to Pakistan at the cost of India but also gave Rs 83 crore to the neighbouring country, whose value now amounts to Rs 5,500 crore.

title: 'Teri choti pakad ke maarunga': Abhishek Sharma to Digvesh Rathi
content: During the IPL 2025 match between LSG and SRH, a heated exchange erupted between Digvesh Rathi and Abhishek Sharma after Rathi dismissed Sharma. Sharma, visibly upset by Rathi's celebration, was caught on camera uttering threats. This incident overshadowed impressive performances from Mitchell Marsh, Aiden Markram, and Nicholas Pooran for LSG, as well as Sharma's explosive innings for SRH.

title: India, Pakistan both key neighbours, will help keep peace: China
content: Asked about reports that China may have provided satellite and air defence support to Pakistan during the conflict, the official said that since tensions started to increase between India and Pakistan, China followed an "objective and just position, urged the two countries to exercise calm and restraint, and avoid escalation".

title: Denmark's largest construction company returns keys of its Tesla cars
content: Danish construction firm Tscherning has divested its entire Tesla fleet, citing Elon Musk's political stances as the primary reason. This decision mirrors a broader trend in Europe, where Tesla's brand image and sales are suffering due to consumer concerns over Musk's political affiliations. The company is opting for European alternatives, highlighting the impact of political views on corporate purchasing decisions.

title: 'Time for MS Dhoni to rest': India's World Cup-winning hero
content: Former teammate Joginder Sharma suggests MS Dhoni should consider retirement after Chennai Super Kings' disappointing IPL season, where they failed to reach the playoffs. Dhoni's future has been questioned, especially with his altered batting position and coach's concerns about his endurance. Joginder, who bowled the iconic final over under Dhoni’s captaincy in the 2007 T20 World Cup final, feels the veteran wicketkeeper-batter should call time on his illustrious 18-year IPL career.

title: 'Became tougher and tougher': Rishabh Pant opens up
content: Rishabh Pant conceded that Lucknow Super Giants' (LSG) IPL 2025 playoff hopes were dashed due to their inability to compensate for key bowlers' injuries. LSG's bowling unit struggled throughout the season, impacting their performance. Despite batting strength, they couldn't maintain momentum in the second half, while young spinner Digvesh Rathi's emergence was a positive takeaway.

title: BHEL, Hyundai & more: Top stocks on brokers' radar today
content: Equirus downgraded Protean eGovernance due to losing a key government project, impacting revenue significantly. Jefferies maintains a hold on Divis Laboratories, citing patent challenges and valuation. Kotak has a sell rating on BHEL due to weak execution. CLSA is positive on Hyundai Motors India, while Morgan Stanley downgraded HAL due to concerns about execution guidance.

title: Microsoft Build 2025 event hit by Pro-Palestine protest; Nadella’s keynote speech disrupted
content: A Microsoft engineer, Joe Lopez, disrupted the Build 2025 conference, protesting the company's AI collaboration with Israel. Shouting 'free Palestine' during CEO Satya Nadella's keynote, Lopez, along with a former Google employee, was escorted out. This follows similar protests at Microsoft's 50th-anniversary event.

title: Plaintiffs only seeking right to access to Sambhal site: HC upholds trial court order
content: While upholding the trial court's survey order, Justice Rohit Ranjan Agarwal vacated the interim stay on the Hindu plaintiffs' suit. The mosque committee had asked for the suit to be dismissed on the ground that the Hindu side's claim to the site was prima facie barred under the Places of Worship Act, 1991. The legislation prohibits conversion of any place of worship and mandates maintaining the religious character of any such site that existed on Aug 15, 1947.

title: Microsoft's fired AI director to 6,000 laid off employees: "These are people who…"
content: Microsoft recently laid off approximately 6,000 employees, impacting various levels and teams. Gabriela de Queiroz, Director of AI for Startups, was among those affected, expressing sadness but maintaining a positive outlook. The layoffs coincide with Microsoft's aggressive push into AI, even as software engineers and AI leadership roles were impacted by the cuts.

title: 'I'm surprised public wasn't told earlier': Trump on Biden's cancer diagnosis
content: Donald Trump has stirred controversy by suggesting a cover-up of Joe Biden's prostate cancer diagnosis, expressing surprise that the public wasn't informed earlier. Trump alluded to the severity of Biden's condition and questioned the timing of its detection. His son, Donald Trump Jr.

title: Trump says Russia, Ukraine to 'immediately start ceasefire negotiations'
content: Following a two-hour phone call with Vladimir Putin, Donald Trump announced that Russia and Ukraine will commence immediate ceasefire negotiations. Trump expressed optimism about the conversation, highlighting the potential for large-scale trade between the US and Russia once the conflict concludes. He also emphasized Ukraine's potential to benefit from trade during its reconstruction.

title: Less water, more rice: Why gene editing of rice may be a game changer
content: With drought-tolerant, climate-resilient rice just two years away from Indian farms, gene editing could change how the country grows its staple. But questions around safety, regulation, and adoption still remain

title: Cracking the 'spy ring': YouTuber, students and smugglers in North India’s Pak-linked network
content: Indian authorities have launched a major crackdown on a Pakistan-linked espionage network, arresting at least 12 individuals across northern states. The suspects, including a YouTuber and an influencer, are accused of relaying sensitive military information to Pakistani intelligence officers. Investigations are ongoing, focusing on digital devices, financial transactions, and potential links to drug smuggling.

title: 'India not a dharmshala': SC rejects Sri Lankan Tamil’s plea seeking refuge
content: The Supreme Court rejected a Sri Lankan national's plea to settle in India after serving a seven-year sentence under UAPA for LTTE links, stating India, burdened with a large population, cannot be a 'dharamshala' for foreign nationals.

title: What is ‘Take it Down Act’? Trump signs landmark law backed by Melania
content: US President Trump signed the 'Take It Down Act,' a federal law criminalizing the sharing of explicit images without consent, including AI-generated fakes. Supported by Melania Trump, the law requires social media platforms to remove such content within 48 hours of a victim's request, potentially facing prison time for offenders.

title: 'Politics' or 'prerogative'? Govt's nominees for anti-terror diplomacy spark row
content: A row has erupted over the selection of representatives for a multi-party global outreach on counter-terrorism. Opposition parties like Congress and Trinamool Congress accuse the government of unilateral decision-making and ignoring their suggestions. The BJP defends the selection process, emphasizing national interest over party politics.

title: IPL: Abhishek shines for SRH as Pant's LSG crash out of playoff race
content: Abhishek Sharma's explosive 59 off 20 balls propelled Sunrisers Hyderabad to a six-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants in IPL 2025. SRH chased down a target of 206 with ease, knocking LSG out of playoff contention. Mitchell Marsh and Aiden Markram's efforts were in vain as LSG's bowling faltered, failing to contain SRH's aggressive batting lineup.

title: Operation Sindoor: How China silently helped Pakistan
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam attack, India's Operation Sindoor targeting terrorist installations prompted China to provide Pakistan with crucial military and satellite support. This assistance, revealed by an Indian defence research group, included reorganizing Pakistan's radar and air defense systems and adjusting satellite coverage over India.

title: 'Told me she was going to Delhi, not Pak': 'Spy' YouTuber's father makes U-turn
content: Jyoti Malhotra, a YouTuber, was arrested under the Official Secrets Act for allegedly possessing suspicious material and having ties to Pakistani intelligence. Initially, her father defended her trips to Pakistan, stating she had the necessary permissions for her YouTube work.

title: Dwyane Wade’s heartfelt reaction to Gabrielle Union’s new post
content: Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union's brand, PROUDLY, expands into baby apparel, available exclusively at JCPenney. Gabrielle Union highlighted the brand's commitment to representation and quality, ensuring all families have access to special products. Dwyane Wade showed his support on social media, while Gabrielle Union also recently shared her early struggles with beauty standards in Hollywood.

title: Viral video: Sanjiv Goenka storms out of balcony after Pant dismissal
content: Lucknow Super Giants owner Sanjiv Goenka's frustration was evident after Rishabh Pant's early dismissal against Sunrisers Hyderabad in a crucial IPL 2025 match. Pant's poor form continued as he managed only 7 runs, adding pressure to LSG's playoff hopes. Goenka's reaction, captured in a viral video, highlighted the high stakes and tension surrounding the team's performance.

title: Watch: Nicholas Pooran loses cool as his dressing-room outburst goes viral
content: Nicholas Pooran's frustration boiled over after a run-out during Lucknow Super Giants' innings against Sunrisers Hyderabad. The vice-captain, visibly upset at missing the opportunity to finish strong, threw an object in the dressing room. This reaction underscores the intense pressure LSG faces as they fight for a playoff spot, where every run and moment is crucial.

title: 'Conflict with Pak was always conventional, no nuclear signaling': Govt to Parl panel
content: The Ministry of External Affairs clarified to a parliamentary committee that the India-Pakistan ceasefire was a bilateral decision, refuting Donald Trump's claims of US mediation. During the meeting, officials confirmed the conflict remained conventional, with no nuclear signaling from Pakistan. India successfully struck Pakistani air bases, regardless of the platforms used.

title: Sanjiv Goenka brutally roasted after his reaction to Pant dismissal
content: Sanjiv Goenka, co-owner of Lucknow Super Giants, faced criticism after cameras captured his visible frustration following Rishabh Pant's dismissal during a crucial IPL match against Sunrisers Hyderabad. Pant's poor performance and Goenka's reaction sparked a social media frenzy, highlighting the intense pressure on both players and owners in the high-stakes playoff race.

title: Congress government in Karnataka completes two years with bouquets and brickbats
content: Siddaramaiah hopes to break the record of being the longest-serving Chief Minister of Karnataka, held by D. Devaraj Urs

title: Fadnavis slams SLBC for not taking action against those seeking CIBIL score from farmers
content: Urging the SLBC to take action against all those bank branches that continue to seek CIBIL scores from the farmers, the Chief Minister said that the practice continues in the State despite previous FIRs in the matter

title: No maintenance if divorce granted on the ground of adultery, says Chhattisgarh HC
content: Both applicants had solemnised their marriage in July 2019 and the woman alleged that after a few days of marriage, she was subjected to mental torture and her character questioned by the husband

title: Panel discussion held to seek justice for Rohingya refugees
content: Human rights lawyers Prashant Bhushan, Colin Gonsalves, and social activist Harsh Mander were present at the panel discussion in the national capital along with journalist Pamela Philipose, human rights activist Rita Manchanda and social worker Priyali Sur

title: Odisha to identify Bangladeshis, disengage them from jobs in State
content: Government to initially focus on six coastal districts and later expand the exercise to the entire State

title: SC sets timelines to facilitate repair of Mullaperiyar dam, tree-felling near site
content: On noting that Kerala had consented to the transportation of materials required for six of the nine repair works pointed out by Tamil Nadu, the apex court said there was hardly any “justification” to not allow the transportation of material required for the remaining three works.

title: Jaishankar holds wide-ranging discussions with Dutch counterpart on deepening bilateral partnership
content: The External Affairs Minister appreciated the Netherlands’ strong condemnation of the Pahalgam attack and support for zero tolerance against terrorism.

title: Cyber fraud complaints of over ₹10 lakh, lodged via helpline or portal, to automatically convert into FIRs
content: The e-Zero FIR initiative has been launched on a pilot basis first in Delhi; complaints have to be registered on the 1930 helpline or cybercrime.gov.in portal

title: Supreme Court grants interim relief to DICCI in sanitation scheme case
content: Bench led by CJI Gavai keeps high court order in abeyance; directs impleadment of DICCI before further hearing

title: Assam Rifles takes note of recruits displaying armed group’s flag
content: An X user has posted the photo of 21 men in the Assam Rifles uniform posing during a passing out parade with the flag of the Zomi Revolutionary Army

title: Gulzar Houz fire: Human Rights Commission flags lapses, seeks detailed report
content: Commission observed that there may have been gross negligence in building safety, electrical upkeep and fire-readiness on the premises

title: Gulzar Houz fire: Telangana health authorities refute rumours of oxygen shortage in ambulances
content: A total of 15 patients were evacuated and shifted to hospitals, all in ‘108’ ambulances equipped with oxygen support, says Director of Public Health and Family Welfare

title: Election Commission begins training programme for field functionaries from Jharkhand
content: The capacity-building programme for frontline election functionaries from Jharkhand was inaugurated by Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar at the India International Institute of Democracy and Election Management

title: Allahabad High Court upholds lower court’s order appointing Advocate Commissioner to survey Sambhal mosque
content: Court dismisses the mosque committee plea, noting that this was not a case of conversion of place of worship and that the Hindu plaintiffs only wanted right of access to a protected monument

title: Army’s Western Command removes video showing Pakistan’s Shaheen missile
content: The video was taken down with Army sources saying the images were used “for representation only” but it was erroneously not mentioned

title: NIA arrests two persons, including one alleged militant, in Manipur violence cases
content: Last week, the NIA had arrested two other accused militants, belonging to different militant outfits.

title: Gaurav Gogoi dares CM Himanta to set up 2 SITs
content: The Congress leader hit back at the Chief Minister after he alleged that Mr. Gogoi visited Pakistan on an invitation from its spy agency ISI

title: Teachers should have trusted govt., fought legally, worked beyond politics, says Mamata
content: Teaching and non-teaching staff have been protesting after their appointments were cancelled by the SC citing irregularities in the 2016 recruitment

title: Lucknow locals say Ali Khan was deliberately targeted
content: A retired police official says the case against the Ashoka University professor will not stand in the court of law

title: Punjab Police arrests two on espionage charges
content: They had shared vital information concerning Operation Sindoor to Pakistan’s ISI, the police said; mobile phones and live cartridges have been recovered from their possession

title: SHRC recommends criminal case against govt. doctor for ‘forcing’ patient to go to private hospital where he practised
content: It also recommends ₹50 lakh in compensation to the husband of a woman who died of burns. While the government is vicariously liable to pay ₹6 lakh, ₹40 lakh is to be recovered from the doctor, ₹2 lakh from a senior civil surgeon, and ₹1 lakh each from two nurses, who too had a role in the transfer of the patient

title: Revisit K. Veeraswami vs Union of India judgment, says Vice-President
content: Appreciating the Supreme Court’s actions following the recovery of cash from a judge’s house,  Jagdeep Dhankhar said a robust judicial system was essential for democracy to survive and blossom

title: U.S. to impose visa restrictions on Indian travel agents who facilitate illegal immigration
content: Announcement by the U.S. State Department spokesperson cited efforts to cut off ‘alien smuggling networks’ and explained that the policy is global and applies even to Visa Waiver Program qualifiers.

title: Indus water belongs to Indian farmers, Chouhan assures farm outfits
content: The decision to keep in abeyance the Indus Waters Treaty corrected the historic injustice done to the country by the Jawaharlal Nehru government, he says while addressing farmers’ organisations

title: Commission pins hope on SC households in Bengaluru taking part in voluntary survey online
content: The door-to door survey has covered just about 23 % of the total households so far; online survey opened on Monday will be available till May 28

title: Indian Railways features Operation Sindoor ‘tribute’ on e-tickets and stations
content: Public outreach includes messaging, documentary on IRCTC platform; 200 stations lit up in tricolour; SpiceJet pilots to honour soldiers in inflight announcements

title: Expected prior hint from India on closure of land ports for our exports: Bangladesh
content: Bangladesh, it is understood, is also watching the Indian side for any further punitive action as the strong step appears to have been initiated because of political reasons

title: Tamil Nadu’s Annual Credit Plan for 2025-26 fixed at ₹9 lakh crore
content: Finance Minister Thangam Thennarasu releases the plan and lauds the banks in the State for their proactive approach in priority sector lending

title: Mismatch between MGNREGS coverage, delivery, says report
content: A study by LibTech India revealed that while the coverage of MGNREGS has increased with 8.6% rise in registered households under the programme, the delivery of promised employment has actually gone down

title: Samsung management, union settle wage issue after Minister holds talks
content: An amicable settlement was reached between the parties on issues relating to wage hikes; as per the agreement, workers will get an overall wage hike of ₹18,000 from April 1, 2025 to March 31, 2028

title: Home Minister launches new OCI portal
content: New portal to provide enhanced functionality, advanced security, and a user-friendly experience for more than 5 million OCI cardholders and new users

title: Vadakadu clash cannot be reduced to a law and order issue, says Thirumavalavan
content: The VCK leader urges Chief Minister M.K. Stalin to issue guidelines for the Collectors and police officers to deal with incidents of violence against the Scheduled Castes

title: More awareness needed on genetic blood disorders: A.P. Health Minister
content: While there are 1,900 people suffering from hemophilia, people affected with thalassemia and sickle cell anemia number around 2,100 each in the State, says Satya Kumar Yadav

title: TTD Trust Board member demands vigilance probe into ‘Tulabharam scam’ in Tirumala during YSRCP government
content: Bhanuprakash Reddy says the amount offered by the devotees towards ‘Tulabharam’ had not reached the TTD exchequer during 2019-2024

title: Tiranga rally held at Kondapi to celebrate Operation Sindoor success
content: Development works worth more than ₹50 crore completed in Kondapi, proposals worth ₹450 crore sent for setting up a drinking water scheme from Ramatheertham to the constituency, says Minister Dr. Dola Sree Bala Veeranjaneya Swamy

title: Mock drill conducted to educate VMC staff about safety measures to prevent fire accidents
content: Fire personnel demonstrate how to respond to a fire alarm, evacuate the building, and manage smoke-filled areas during the drill

title: Pakistan’s drone and missile attacks targeting the Golden Temple in Amritsar were thwarted: Indian Army
content: Pakistan attempted to target the Golden Temple on the intervening night of May 7-8; India’s air defence system, including indigenous Akash missiles and L-70 air defence guns, intercepted the Pakistani drones and missiles

title: Allegations against officials part of attempts to derail investigation, alleges ED
content: Aneesh Babu has alleged that some persons had demanded money for settling a case booked against him under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). The Vigilance has arrested Wilson Varghese, Mukesh Kumar from Rajasthan, and Kochi-based chartered accountant Renjith Warrier in this connection

title: Keep a close watch on suspected terrorist activities in Andhra Pradesh in the wake of Operation Sindoor, Pawan Kalyan tells Chief Secretary and DGP
content: He stresses the need for special surveillance along the coastal areas and on the likely presence of Rohingyas, terrorist sympathisers and sleeper cells

title: Special Task Force constituted to probe into liquor deaths in Jangareddygudem in 2022
content: 20 persons, including a couple of women, reportedly died due to consumption of liquor contaminated with methyl alcohol in March 2022, in Jangareddygudem and the neighbouring areas

title: Schools in Poonch, the worst-hit in military confrontation, reopen to only 16% attendance
content: The area saw over 14 civilian deaths and injuries to dozens in the recent Pakistan shelling; parents still feel insecure

title: COVID-19 cases see a surge in Singapore, Hong Kong; India reports 257 cases — all mild: Health Ministry
content: The statement comes following a recent review meeting of experts from National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC), Emergency Medical Relief (EMR) division, Disaster Management Cell, Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) and Central government hospitals

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister to conduct surprise inspections after June 12 to get feedback on implementation of welfare schemes
content: Emphasis should be laid on ensuring cent per cent public satisfaction as the coalition government is completing one year soon, says Naidu at a review meeting

title: Improve sanitation in Kurnool city: Minister Bharath
content: Minister says, “If there is no improvement in sanitation, the staff and officials concerned will be held responsible, and action will be taken against them.”

title: Surankote temple attack: Chargesheet filed against two, including one based in Pakistan
content: Two accused named, including a Pakistan-based Hizbul Mujahideen operative; SIA alleges cross-border conspiracy to incite communal unrest in J&K

title: 1.11 lakh eligible families to get title deeds during Sadhana Samavesha (For State page)
content: Shivakumar said they had arrived at the plan distribute them at Hosapete event after extensive study and research

title: Chief Minister is ‘outsourcing Punjab’s governance to Delhi bosses’, says State BJP chief
content: BJP leader Sunil Jakhar leads delegation to Punjab Governor; demands ED inquiry into alleged liquor mafia nexus, terms incident a ‘preventable tragedy’

title: Colourful procession marks BJP’s Tiranga Yatra in Bagalkot
content: The saffron party organised the rally to celebrate the success of Operation Sindoor against terror camps in Pakistan

title: Traffic hit as portion of under-construction elevated NH-66 caves in at Kooriyad
content: The elevated highway portion across the paddy fields of Kooriyad caved in and damaged three cars moving along the service road about 30 ft down. Passengers ran for cover leaving their cars behind as boulders and debris came crashing down from the height. Six of them suffered minor injuries

title: Free agency and draft plans for Maple Leafs, Capitals, every other eliminated team
content: the 2024-25 NHL regular season is over and the playoffs are underway . this is the place where we look ahead to the offseason for all the eliminated teams . read on for a look at what went wrong for each eliminated team .

title: Scottie Scheffler is still on top of the golf world
content: charLOTTE, n.c., wins his third career major title . scottie Scheffler finishes 12 under par to secure his third major championship . sergio aguero finishes 12th under par after a stern facial expression .

title: QB tiers for every FBS program: Returning stars, blue-chip freshmen, transfers and, of course, Arch Manning
content: 2025 is the unofficial end point of the bonus year . if you're Diego Pavia, who might play until he's eligible to collect social security . some of last season's rules allowed players to stick around for five, six or even seven years .

title: Week 14: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: the LSU Tigers remain no. 1 but there was plenty of shakeup in the rest of the rankings . this week's biggest risers were Southern Miss, who jumped up nine spots, and the surging Florida Gators, who are now at no. 15 .

title: Early look at the Stars-Oilers matchup in the Western Conference finals
content: the Western Conference finals matchup is set for 2025 . the Dallas Stars and Edmonton Oilers are poised to square off to determine which club will represent the West in the Stanley Cup Final . we're here with key intel from ESPN Research, wagering info from ESPN BET .

title: NBA playoffs betting: How to bet the conference finals
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder take on the Minnesota Timberwolves in the Western Conference . the new york Knicks face the Indiana Pacers in the eastern conference . for latest odds go to ESPN BET Timberwolves +1.5 games (+140)

title: NWSL: Chawinga's brilliance keeps Current No. 1
content: Temwa Chawinga scored a goal to put the Kansas City Current ahead . the current beat the Pride 1-0 on friday . it's a week of NWSL action in the books . if you make a single mistake, you're likely to get punished .
